3.question: 1. How long have you lived here (approximately)?

4.question: 2. In general, do you like where you are living right now?

5.question: 3. What don't you like about where you live? Check all that apply.

10025.answer: Manager doesn't keep building maintained. Heater vent in hallway has malfunctioning thermostat and its never been fixed despite repeat requests. Electrical issues in apartment that aren't addresses. Hole in wall improperly repaired. No insulation, doors and windows don't seal. Tenants allowed to do drugs. Unsafe for disabled people, meaning bathrooms. Request form for grab bars, asked for 4, only got 2, needs one in tub and one to pull out of tub. Was approved for four.

6.question: 4. Do you want to live somewhere else?

7.question: 5. Where do you want to live? Check all that apply.

10038.option: A DIFFERENT TYPE OF GEOGRAPHY OR CLIMATE (EX: CLOSE TO THE BEACH, MOUNTAINS, WHERE IT'S COLDER OR WARMER, ETC)

13.question: 6. Do you have friends or family who do not live with you but who are a part of your life? If the person lives with family, ask about other family members that do not live at that residence.

14.question: 7. Are you able to see or talk to your friends and family who do not live with you when you want to?

15.question: 8. Why not/why only sometimes? Check all that apply.

10073.option: PHYSICAL ACCESSIBILITY (E.G., RAMP NEEDED, DOORWAYS TOO NARROW)

10078.option: NO OR LIMITED ACCESS TO THE INTERNET

17.question: 9. PROXY ALLOWED Do you get any services provided by the state/federal funding (such as personal care services, homemaker or chore services, transportation)?

18.question: 10. PROXY ALLOWED How did you find out about the services you can get? Check all that apply.

19.question: 11. Are services and supports delivered in a way that is respectful of your culture? This can be things like respecting your religion, your beliefs, the food you prefer, or the holidays you celebrate.

20.question: 12. PROXY ALLOWED If the person's language is not English: Do you get information about your services in the language you prefer?

21.question: 13. PROXY ALLOWED Do you have a case manager or care coordinator - someone whose job it is to help set up and coordinate services with you?

22.question: 14. Does your case manager/care coordinator change more often than you'd like?

23.question: 15. PROXY ALLOWED Can you reach your case manager/care coordinator when you need to?

24.question: 16. If you have a complaint about your services, do you know whom to contact to make that complaint?

25.question: 17. PROXY ALLOWED Can you choose (or change) your services?

26.question: 18. PROXY ALLOWED Can you choose (or change) when and how often you get your services?

27.question: 19. PROXY ALLOWED Do service providers work together to provide support? For example, does the agency providing transportation work together with the agency providing in-home support if necessary?

28.question: 20. If you want to make changes to your services, do you know whom to contact?

29.question: 21. PROXY ALLOWED How much help with everyday activities do you generally need? Things like preparing meals, housework, shopping, or taking medications. Read response options.

30.question: 22. PROXY ALLOWED Do you always get enough help with your everyday activities when you need it?

31.question: 23. PROXY ALLOWED How much help with self-care do you generally need? Things like bathing, dressing, going to the bathroom, eating or moving around your home/where you live. Read response options.

34.question: 24. PROXY ALLOWED Do you always get enough help with self-care when you need it?

37.question: 25. PROXY ALLOWED Is there anyone who helps you at home/where you live or in the community on a regular basis, or at least once a week? This may be any kind of help - either with self-care needs, or everyday activities.

38.question: 26. PROXY ALLOWED Who is the person who helps you most often? Select one.

39.question: 27. PROXY ALLOWED Who else provides assistance for you when you need help? Check all that apply.

10221.answer: Senior center for medical transportation, cab services for transportation but can't take wheelchair

41.question:
Questions 28 through 34 ("paid support questions") may only be asked if paid support workers are not present for the survey (or cannot hear survey questions). These questions are only applicable for people who have paid support workers (including paid family members or friends). If paid support workers (or paid family or friends) are present, ask them to step out of the room for questions 28 through 34. If they refuse or if the person needs them to be present, skip these questions and go to question 35.

S-1 SURVEYOR QUESTION Are "paid support questions" applicable and are the paid support staff out of the room?

42.question: 28. PROXY ALLOWED Can you choose (or change) the people who are paid to help you if you wanted to?

43.question: 29. PROXY ALLOWED Do the people who are paid to help you show up and leave when they are supposed to?

44.question: 30. PROXY ALLOWED Do you have a backup plan if the person who is paid to help you doesn't show up?

45.question:
31. PROXY ALLOWED Do the people who are paid to help you change too often?

60.question: 37. PROXY ALLOWED Are you able to get to safety quickly in case of an emergency like a house fire?

  • 1 dose of Johnson & Johnson's Janssen
  • 2 doses of Novavax given 3-8 weeks apart

426.question: SDS-1. PROXY ALLOWED Who makes decisions about the services that are self-directed? Things like what services you use, hiring or firing staff, scheduling services.

427.question:
S-3 SURVEYOR: Does anyone participating in the survey meeting help make self-direction decisions (this may be the person, a proxy respondent or other person present at the meeting)?

Note to surveyor: if it is unclear whether anyone in the survey meeting participates in these decisions, ask: Do you [person, proxy, and/or other person present] help make self-direction decisions? Things like deciding what services are received, how to use the persons supports budget, hiring staff, or managing the services received?

429.question: SDS-2. PROXY ALLOWED Do you have enough help deciding how to direct your services? Things like making decisions about how and when you get services?

430.question: SDS-3. PROXY ALLOWED Can you make changes to the services and supports you self-direct if you need to?

431.question:
SDS-4. PROXY ALLOWED Do you have the amount of control you want with the services you self-direct?

Note to surveyor: This is about the person being able to self-direct in the way they want. It is not about availability of services, but about whether the respondent feels there are unfair or unreasonable restrictions over what services can be chosen.

432.question: SDS-5. PROXY ALLOWED Are the services and supports you want to self-direct always available? This includes things like having the services that you want available when you want them and having enough staff to hire.

434.question: SDS-6. PROXY ALLOWED Do you get information about your budget and services from ACES$?

435.question: SDS-7. PROXY ALLOWED Is the information you get from ACES$ easy to understand?

436.question: SDS-8. PROXY ALLOWED How often do you get the information about your budget and services from ACES$? Do you get information... Read response options.

D-1 What is your favorite season?

454.question: SW-1. Is there anything else you'd like to tell me that we did not cover today? As a friendly reminder, this survey, and the information you share with me, is confidential.
454.answer: Smoke detector has not been repaired by building manager. Senior Center transportation has limited hours, is booked 2 weeks out, and they make little effort to employ new drivers. Heating and cooling are so loud it makes it difficult to hear anything else. General lack of maintenance to residence. Threatening to evict someone for complaining.

458.question: 58.i. Some other equipment:
458.answer: Grab bars in bathroom and walk in shower

860.question:
Physical disability
(Total or partial loss of a persons bodily function or part of the body which substantially limits one or more major life activities)

865.question:
Traumatic brain injury or other acquired brain injury
(Brain damage caused by events after birth, rather than as part of a genetic or congenital disorder)

866.question:
Intellectual or other developmental disability
(Diagnosed before age 22; disorders that are usually present at birth and that affect the trajectory of the individuals physical, intellectual, and/or emotional development)

867.question:
Heart Disease
(Refers to several types of heart conditions. The most common type of heart disease in the United States is coronary artery disease (CAD), which affects the blood flow to the heart.)

869.question:
Cancer
(Refers to diseases in which abnormal cells divide out of control and are able to invade other tissues. Cancer cells can spread to other parts of the body.)

870.question:
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
(Refers to a group of diseases that cause airflow blockage and breathing-related problems. It includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis.)

871.question:
Stroke
(A stroke occurs when something blocks blood supply to part of the brain or when a blood vessel in the brain bursts. In either case, parts of the brain become damaged.)

872.question:
Diabetes
(Diabetes is a health condition that affects how your body turns food into energy. Includes Type I and Type II.)

873.question:
Alzheimer's disease or dementia
(Decline in memory or other cognitive skills that may reduce a person's ability to perform everyday activities)

874.question:
Hypertension (or High Blood Pressure)
(Blood pressure that is consistently higher than normal).

877.question:
BI-15. Do you have a chronic psychiatric or mental health diagnosis diagnosed by a doctor? Some examples are schizophrenia, bipolar, or major depressive disorders.

Other Respondent: Does this person have a chronic psychiatric or mental health diagnosis diagnosed by a doctor? Some examples are schizophrenia, bipolar, or major depressive disorders.

878.question:
BI-16. What is your level of mobility? Check all that apply.

Other Respondent: What is the persons level of mobility?

881.question:
BI-17. Do you have a history of frequent falls (more than two falls in a six-month period)?

905.question: P30. (58).h. Other assistive technology (technology to help in your everyday life to do more things on your own like apps to get around, alerts to remind you of things to do like take medications):

931.question:
BI-9. Who else lives with you in your residence (i.e. your living unit)? Check all that apply.
